001package io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.annotation;
002
003import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
004import java.lang.annotation.Repeatable;
005import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
006import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
007import java.lang.annotation.Target;
008
009/**
010 * Defines a pre-test setup step ("journey") to be executed before the test runs.
011 *
012 * <p>This annotation is used to specify a predefined setup action ("journey") that should be executed
013 * before a test starts. It is typically applied in combination with {@code @PreQuest}
014 * to configure multiple setup steps in a defined order.
015 *
016 * <p>The framework processes this annotation using reflection in order to resolve the specified journey,
017 * execute the corresponding setup logic, and inject any required test data.
018 *
019 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
020 */
021@Repeatable(PreQuest.class)
022@Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
023@Target(ElementType.METHOD)
024public @interface Journey {
025
026   /**
027    * Specifies the journey to be executed before the test.
028    *
029    * <p>The value should match a predefined journey identifier, which the framework
030    * resolves and executes to set up the necessary preconditions for the test.
031    *
032    * @return The name of the journey.
033    */
034   String value();
035
036   /**
037    * Defines additional test data to be used within the journey.
038    *
039    * <p>This allows the journey to be parameterized with specific test data objects,
040    * which are resolved dynamically by the framework.
041    *
042    * @return An array of {@code JourneyData} objects containing test data.
043    */
044   JourneyData[] journeyData() default {};
045
046   /**
047    * Specifies the execution order of the journey when multiple journeys are defined.
048    *
049    * <p>Lower values indicate higher priority, meaning they will be executed first.
050    *
051    * @return The execution order of the journey.
052    */
053   int order() default 0;
054
055}
